author: Sana Pashankar
description: NASA is planning to divest or demolish nearly half of its footprint at the Goddard Spaceflight Center in Greenbelt, Maryland, after President Donald Trump’s efforts to shrink the federal workforce led to a mass employee exodus, according to an email seen by Bloomberg News.
title: NASA to Divest, Demolish Buildings at Maryland’s Goddard Center

author: Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump called on Congress to pass a federal standard governing oversight of artificial intelligence and warned that varied regulation at the state level risked slowing the development of an emerging technology that’s critical to the US economy.
title: Trump Urges Congress to Block State-Level AI Regulation

author: Sherif Tarek
description: An airstrike killed at least 13 people in Lebanon’s largest Palestinian refugee camp, one of Israel’s deadliest attacks on its neighboring country’s southern region that the Jewish state continues to pound despite calls to halt its offensive.
title: Israeli Strike Kills 13 at Palestinian Refugee Camp in Lebanon

author: Alex Wickham
description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is seeking a probe into dentistry prices and will impose tougher rules on fuel providers, pinning her hopes for reducing the cost of living on a regulator she once criticized.
title: Reeves Turns to Regulator She Criticized to Help Curb UK Prices

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: Senator Todd Young is urging the IRS to review and reconsider earlier guidelines on the tax treatment of rewards cryptocurrency owners collect in exchange for “staking,” or locking assets on a blockchain network to aid its operation and validate transactions.
title: Senate Republican Presses IRS on Tax Treatment of Crypto Staking

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: Rap star Nicki Minaj made an appearance at the US mission to the United Nations on Tuesday to echo President Donald Trump’s claim that Nigeria is failing to prevent the persecution of Christians. Experts argue the truth is more complicated.
title: Nicki Minaj Echoes Trump’s Message in Denouncing Nigeria Attacks

author: John Liu, Jing Li, Colum Murphy
description: Three years ago, Chinese Premier Li Qiang took on a role largely stripped of its former glory. Now, in a surprise twist, he’s becoming President Xi Jinping’s top emissary on the world stage.
title: Xi Is Making China’s Premier His Top Messenger on World Stage

author: Anna Edgerton, Madlin Mekelburg, Julie Fine
description: Texas Republicans had a plan to give President Donald Trump and his party an advantage in next year’s midterm elections. Right now, it’s backfiring.
title: GOP Bid to Tilt Election Map Backfires After Texas Court Ruling

author: Loren Grush
description: President Donald Trump’s pick to lead NASA, Jared Isaacman, will face another Senate confirmation hearing on Dec. 3, following the administration’s renomination of the fintech billionaire to run the agency.
title: Trump’s Revived NASA Pick, Isaacman, To Face New Senate Hearing

author: Joe Sobczyk
description: House votes overwhelmingly to compel the release of government documents.
title: Trump and Republicans Swamped by Demands for Epstein Files

author: Erik Larson
description: President Donald Trump’s lawyers appeared before an appeals court in Alabama to try to revive a civil suit accusing Hillary Clinton of leading a conspiracy to bog down his 2016 presidential campaign with bogus allegations tying him to Russia.
title: Trump Seeks to Revive Suit Accusing Clinton of Russia Conspiracy

author: Ari Natter
description: Constellation Energy Corp.’s plan to restart its shuttered Three Mile Island nuclear plant is getting $1 billion in backing from the US government as the Trump administration pushes to add more atomic power on the electric grid.
title: Constellation Gets $1 Billion Loan to Open Three Mile Island Nuclear Plant

author: Laura Dhillon Kane
description: Canada and Sweden announced a strategic partnership to deepen cooperation on defense and trade, as the North American nation looks to reduce its dependence on the US for military equipment and as an export market.
title: Canada and Sweden Partner to Grow Defense and Trade Ties

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Akshat Rathi
description: Senator Sheldon Whitehouse, the only representative of the US federal government showing up at this year’s United Nations climate summit, has a simple message for the almost 200 countries gathered in Brazil: When you’re facing President Donald Trump’s ire, don’t back down.
title: Only US Lawmaker at COP30 Tells Nations to Stand Up to Trump

author: Jamie Tarabay, Erik Wasson
description: Donald Trump’s firm control of Washington showed signs of weakening Tuesday as nearly all House Republicans voted to compel the Justice Department to release its files on sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein, whose earlier ties to the president have been the subject of intense scrutiny.
title: House Votes to Release Epstein Files, Teeing Up Senate Approval

author: Liam Knox
description: The Trump administration said it will transfer some of the Education Department’s largest grant programs and major portions of several offices to other federal agencies, part of a broader plan to greatly reduce the department’s authority.
title: Trump Takes Major Step Toward Dismantling Education Department

author: Andrea Palasciano, Jorge Valero, Suzanne Lynch
description: The European Union’s deep economic ties to China are constraining its ability to pressure Beijing over Russia’s war in Ukraine, the bloc’s top diplomat said.
title: EU Warns Its Ties to China Hamper Ability to Punish Russia

author: Annmarie Hordern
description: President Donald Trump renewed his call for the US Federal Communications Commission to revoke station licenses for ABC after a reporter for the network asked about his handling of files related to disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein.
title: Trump Threatens ABC Station Licenses After Epstein Questions

author: Ryan Autullo
description: A federal court shot down Texas’ bid to redraw its congressional districts, delivering a loss to President Donald Trump and closing a path for Republicans to gain five House seats in next year’s midterm elections.
title: Texas Redistricting Plan Blocked by Court, Upending GOP Strategy

author: Annmarie Hordern, Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump said he thinks he’s identified his choice to be the next chair of the Federal Reserve while asserting people are holding him back from firing the central bank’s current leader, Jerome Powell.
title: Trump Says He Thinks He Already Knows His Choice for Fed Chair

author: Martin Z Braun
description: Connecticut transferred about $1.5 billion in excess budget reserves to its underfunded state employees’ and teachers’ pensions, bringing extra deposits in the funds to more than $10 billion over the last six years, state Treasurer Erick Russell said Tuesday.
title: Connecticut Deposits $1.5 Billion in State Pensions: Treasurer

author: Stephan Kueffner
description: Ecuadorian President Daniel Noboa reshuffled his cabinet after a shock loss in a referendum where he sought voter backing to revamp the constitution in a bid to tackle rising crime.
title: Ecuador’s Noboa Shuffles Cabinet After Voters Reject Referendum

author: Christina Kyriasoglou
description: SAP SE will maintain access to Microsoft Corp.’s cloud services even if a foreign government attempts to cut it off, after Donald Trump’s administration sanctioned an international court in the Hague.
title: SAP to Keep Microsoft EU Cloud Running If Trump Orders Shutdown

author: Andrew Rosati
description: The reasons why South Americans are electing right-wing candidates this year differ in each country: Empty fuel tanks and scarce dollars in Bolivia, chronic economic crises in Argentina, fears over runaway migration and violent crime in Chile.
title: Crime and Economic Woes Push South American Voters to the Right

author: Andrea Palasciano, Suzanne Lynch
description: The European Union’s top diplomat said that Moscow’s aggression against the bloc, including an explosion that occurred in Poland over the weekend, should be considered terrorism.
title: Russia Attacks on EU Are State-Sponsored Terrorism, Top Diplomat Says

author: Michael D McDonald
description: El Salvador boosted its holdings of Bitcoin by more than $100 million this week, appearing to buy the dip during a severe rout in the largest cryptocurrency’s value.
title: Bukele Boosts El Salvador’s Bitcoin Holdings by $100 Million

author: Myles Miller
description: President Donald Trump’s border czar said federal immigration teams are already operating in New York City and that additional agents are being deployed, pledging to “flood the zone” in response to the city’s sanctuary policies.
title: Trump Border Czar Plans NYC ICE Surge After Mamdani Reaches Out

author: Jimmy Jenkins, Erik Wasson
description: Republican Marjorie Taylor Greene excoriated Donald Trump’s protracted resistance to releasing investigative files on Jeffrey Epstein as damaging to the populist Republican movement the president helped build.
title: Epstein File Fight Has Ripped Apart MAGA, Greene Says

author: Joe Mayes, Philip Aldrick
description: Rachel Reeves will deliver an improved fiscal buffer at next week’s budget, one of her closest colleagues will tell finance executives on Tuesday night, even as economists doubt the chancellor’s ability to raise the necessary sums.
title: UK City Minister Promises Bigger Fiscal Buffer in Reeves’ Budget

author: Maria Clara Cobo, Paola Vega Torre
description: President Claudia Sheinbaum again ruled out a US military intervention in Mexico, pushing back on the latest suggestion of unilateral action from President Donald Trump.
title: Sheinbaum Pushes Back on Trump, Insists US Won’t Strike Mexico

author: Daryna Krasnolutska, Firat Kozok
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy wants to leverage growing US pressure on Moscow to revive stalled diplomatic efforts to end Russia’s war, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Zelenskiy Seeks to Use US Pressure on Russia to Restart Talks

author: Olivia Fletcher, Jennifer Duggan
description: Ireland’s deputy prime minister, Simon Harris, will take over the finance ministry after the surprise resignation of Paschal Donohoe to join the World Bank.
title: Harris to Steer Irish Economy as Trump Re-Shoring Threat Looms

author: Alexander Weber
description: An unexpected vacancy at the top of the Eurogroup is scrambling the already complex task of replacing two thirds of the European Central Bank’s upper echelon over the next two years.
title: ECB Jobs Race Jolted by Shock Exit of Euro-Area Finance Chief

author: Carolina Gonzalez, Antonia Mufarech
description: Chile presidential candidate José Antonio Kast tapped a slew of high-profile economists who had worked with a more moderate rival, giving his campaign a crucial, investor-friendly boost.
title: Chile Presidential Favorite Kast Signs Up Top Economic Advisors

author: Olivia Fletcher
description: Simon Harris, deputy premier and current foreign minister, will become Ireland’s next finance minister after the surprise resignation of Paschal Donohoe Tuesday morning.
title: Ireland’s Simon Harris to Become Finance Minister

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, John Ainger
description: Negotiators leading United Nations climate talks in Brazil laid out options for addressing the world’s disappointing progress in curbing greenhouse gas emissions, though countries remain far apart on finance and trade policy.
title: Climate Talks Enter Crunch Time at COP30 Summit in Brazil

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said he will not support legislation to extend expanded Affordable Care Act subsidies even as senators are preparing to tee up a vote on the issue, complicating his party’s efforts to address health care costs.
title: Trump Tells Congress Don’t ‘Waste’ Time on Obamacare Credits

author: Julian Lee
description: The value of oil shipments from Russian ports fell to the lowest since April 2023
title: Russia’s Oil Flows and Prices Deepen Slide in Hit to War Funding

author: Lucy White, James Woolcock
description: Nigel Farage and Kemi Badenoch vied for the UK’s political spotlight on Tuesday, in dueling briefings that underscored the risks that next week’s budget announcement carries for Prime Minister Keir Starmer.
title: Reform and Tory Leaders Go Head to Head in Battle for UK Right

author: Alex Wickham
description: The UK’s domestic security service, MI5, has issued an alert to British lawmakers warning of new Chinese espionage activity targeting them on social media and professional networking sites.
title: MI5 Warns UK Lawmakers of New Chinese Espionage Threat

author: Dan Williams
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu made an unusual pledge to crack down on violence by hardline Jewish settlers against Palestinians in the West Bank, which has put the territory on edge as world powers try to stabilize the post-war Gaza Strip.
title: Netanyahu Vows Crackdown on Jewish Settler Violence in West Bank

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy is set to sign a defense cooperation agreement with Spanish companies during his visit to Madrid on Tuesday, according to a Spanish government official.
title: Zelenskiy and Spanish Defense Companies to Sign Cooperation Deal

author: Agnieszka Barteczko
description: Polish authorities said Russia was likely behind an explosion that damaged a key rail link for shipments and travel to Ukraine.
title: Polish Authorities Say Russia Is Likely Behind Railway Explosion

author: Sam Dagher, Kate Sullivan
description: Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman will meet US President Donald Trump at the White House on Tuesday, cementing a burgeoning relationship that the oil-rich kingdom says will advance peace and stability in the Middle East.
title: Trump to Host Saudi’s MBS With Eye Toward Defense, Tech Deals

author: Abeer Abu Omar
description: Donald Trump’s plan has taken an important step forward with backing from the UN Security Council.
title: Pursuing an Elusive Peace Framework for Gaza

author: Charlie Zhu
description: Chinese state-owned firms including major banks are advising employees to avoid scheduling trips to Japan as a diplomatic row has raised tensions between the two nations.
title: China State Firms Caution Staff Against Japan Travel Amid Spat

author: Chandra Asmara
description: Indonesian lawmakers have passed a sweeping revision to the Criminal Procedure Code, which they said would modernize an outdated justice system by speeding up prosecutions and aligning legal procedures with a new criminal code set to take effect in 2026.
title: Indonesia Approves Major Overhaul of Criminal Procedure Code

author: Mark Bergen, Omar El Chmouri
description: Tareq Amin has a sales pitch that’s opened virtually every door in Silicon Valley: If you’re looking for AI computing power, come to Saudi Arabia.
title: Saudi’s Oil Wealth Is Moving to AI. Now MBS Needs Trump’s Blessing

author: Jennifer Duggan, Suzanne Lynch
description: Paschal Donohoe is set to step down as Ireland’s finance minister to become the managing director at the World Bank.
title: Ireland’s Donohoe to Exit Government, Eurogroup for World Bank

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said the US would sell F-35 fighter jets to Saudi Arabia, offering Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman a prize he’s long cherished, ahead of a visit to the White House on Tuesday.
title: Trump Approves F-35 Jets for Saudi Arabia Ahead of MBS Visit

author: Andrea Palasciano, Oliver Crook
description: President Donald Trump’s envoy to NATO said European allies should take a “more aggressive” approach to Moscow and move forward with plans to tap immobilized Russian assets to fund Ukraine’s war effort.
title: Trump NATO Envoy Says EU Should Take ‘Aggressive’ Line on Russia

author: Tara Patel
description: A French tax break for company owners bequeathing assets to their offspring needs an urgent overhaul after costing the government more than €5.5 billion ($6.4 billion) last year, according to the state auditor.
title: France’s €5.5 billion ‘Dutreil’ Tax Break Is Slammed by Auditor

author: Ditas B Lopez
description: The Philippines’ anti-graft watchdog filed criminal charges against resigned lawmaker Zaldy Co and public works officials for their alleged involvement in irregularities in flood infrastructure.
title: Philippines Files First Cases Against Officials in Graft Scandal

author: Toru Fujioka
description: Governor Kazuo Ueda told Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi that the Bank of Japan is in the process of gradually adjusting its degree of monetary easing, signaling his unshaken intention to carefully raise rates.
title: Ueda Signals BOJ Remains on Rate Hike Path After Takaichi Meet

author: S'thembile Cele, Reto Gregori
description: Leaders from the Group of 20 nations will take decisive action to reform the global financial architecture and make other key decisions at their annual summit this week, despite US President Donald Trump’s absence, according to a top official from South Africa, which is hosting the gathering in Johannesburg.
title: G-20 Summit Will Move On Without US, Host South Africa Says

author: James Mayger
description: Recent comments by Japan’s leader about the possibility of military action around Taiwan shows Japan is returning to the path of militarism, Chinese state media said in a commentary, adding that any “militarist fantasies” would blow up in Tokyo’s face.
title: China Accuses Takaichi of Reviving Japan’s ‘Militarist Demons’

author: Francesca Stevens
description: Vietnam’s police have launched a criminal investigation into a Berlin-based Vietnamese journalist and website editor for alleged anti-state activities.
title: Vietnam Police Probe Berlin-Based Editor Over ‘Anti-State’ Acts

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: Spain’s politicians really can’t agree on a budget, and that’s working out just fine for the public finances.
title: Spanish Budget Stalemate Keeps Government’s Spending Drive in Check

author: Andreo Calonzo
description: A former Philippine property tycoon who led tariff talks with the US will manage the nation’s finances, as President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. seeks to calm investors rattled by a widening corruption scandal.
title: Marcos’ New Philippine Finance Chief Seen as Safe, Pro-Business Choice

author: Erica Yokoyama, Akemi Terukina
description: A group of lawmakers in Japan’s ruling Liberal Democratic Party urged Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi to craft an extra budget much larger than what’s been indicated thus far as she puts the finishing touches on her economic package.
title: Japanese Ruling Party Bloc Pushes for Major Jump in Extra Budget

author: Anna Edney
description: A US congressional commission is ringing alarm bells about China’s growing dominance over America’s drug supply, saying it is putting the country’s health in the hands of an adversarial nation.
title: China’s Grip on American Medicine Cabinets Grows More Entrenched

author: Lucy White, Alex Wickham
description: Shortly after Prime Minister Keir Starmer appointed Shabana Mahmood as the UK’s Home Secretary in September, she set out her stall to a packed room at the Labour Party’s annual conference.
title: Starmer’s Chief Weapon Against Farage is Also a Potential Rival

author: Robert Burnson
description: A federal judge rejected the Trump administration’s request to strike down a New York law prohibiting immigration agents from making arrests at or near state courthouses.
title: New York Ban on Migrant Arrests in Courts Survives Trump Challenge

author: Alastair Gale
description: Japan is mounting a broad diplomatic effort to ease tensions with China after Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s comments on Taiwan sparked a sharp backlash from Beijing that raised fears of a breakdown in economic ties.
title: Japan Steps Up Diplomatic Push to Calm China After Taiwan Furor

author: Anuchit Nguyen
description: Thailand’s former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra faces renewed legal troubles after prosecutors moved to appeal his acquittal in a royal defamation case and the country’s top court separately ordered him to pay hundreds of millions of dollars in back taxes.
title: Thaksin Faces Revived Royal Insult Case and $542 Million Tax Bill

author: Rong Wei Neo, Serene Cheong
description: Expanding sanctions on Chinese ports and refiners are choking flows of Russian and Iranian oil to the world’s No. 1 importer, although emerging workarounds suggest the slowdown may be fleeting.
title: Fear of Sanctions Stymies Russia-to-China Oil Flows for Now

author: Pierre Paulden
description: Former Harvard President Larry Summers said he plans to step back from his public commitments after his correspondence with the late disgraced sex offender Jeffrey Epstein was made public by US lawmakers.
title: Summers to Step Back From Public Roles After Epstein Backlash

author: Toru Fujioka
description: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi faces mounting pressure to soften her stance on Bank of Japan policy and unveil an economic package with a credible funding plan as the yen and government bonds lose ground ahead of her meeting with BOJ Governor Kazuo Ueda.
title: Yen, Bonds Add Pressure on Takaichi Ahead of Meeting With Ueda

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan’s Finance Minister strengthened her warning over the yen’s slide as the currency fell past the 155-per-dollar level, as reports of a larger-than-expected economic package fuels the view that Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s pro-stimulus stance may slow Bank of Japan rate hikes.
title: Japan’s Katayama Strengthens FX Warning as Yen Slides Past 155

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: North Korea criticized Washington’s recent approval for South Korea to develop nuclear-powered submarines, saying the move risks igniting a global arms race.
title: North Korea Says Seoul Submarine to Have Nuclear Domino Effect

author: Kate Sullivan, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump argued his administration was making process on lowering prices as he faces new political headwinds, pushing back on criticism from Democrats who blame his tariffs for high costs.
title: Trump Hails McDonald’s Extra Value Meals in Affordability Pitch

author: Manolo Serapio Jr, Ditas B Lopez
description: Rising anger in the Philippines over a huge corruption scandal has forced out two ministers from President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.’s cabinet, testing his administration’s efforts to restore public trust and investor confidence.
title: Pressure Builds on Marcos as Philippine Graft Mess Forces Revamp

author: Brian Platt
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney won a key budget vote by the slimmest of margins in Canada’s Parliament, ensuring the survival of his government.
title: Canada Avoids Election as Carney Budget Narrowly Passes Vote

author: Swati Pandey
description: More than half of Australians are concerned about US interference while support for defense spending has reached a new high, according to a nationwide poll that comes as friction mounts between the allies over issues such as trade.
title: Australians Are Increasingly Wary of US Interference, Poll Shows
